IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: METROPOLITAN INTER-FAITH ASSOCIATION'S PRIMARY EXEMPT PURPOSE IS TO SUSTAIN THE INDEPENDENCE OF THE FRAIL ELDERLY, STABILIZE AND TRANSFORM FAMILIES IN CRISIS, AND EQUIP TEENS FOR SUCCESS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: MIFA is an interfaith nonprofit social service agency operating in memphis, Tennessee and surrounding areas. Mifa's nine programs help change lives by sustaining the independence of seniors, stabilizing and transforming families in crisis and equipping urban teens for success. MIFA serves over 60,000 clients annually.
IRS990.Description: mifa meals on wheels serves over 1,800 hot, nutritious home delivered and congregate meals to seniors in a four county area monday thru friday. the program served 2,293 unduplicated clients a total of 388,877 meals during fy2010.

Activity2.Description: MIFA Emergency Services provides the community with a safety net for needed basic services: food, utility assistance, rental and mortgage assistance. Food Vouchers were provided to 11,032 families last fiscal year, and financial assistance was provided to 4,305 families. MIFA Emergency Services receives approximately 12,000 requests for financial assistance each year from the community in need. Applicants must demonstrate a recent unavoidable emergency.

Activity3.Description: MIFA Housing Opportunities program provides transitional housing for homeless families. Families are permitted to stay up to 24 months, and are expected to attend life skills classes, seek employment, and make plans for permanent housing. Last fiscal year MHO served 96 families.

ActivityOther.Description: other social services provided to the memphis area including additional senior services such as the senior companion program, handymen, long-term care ombudsman and mifa transit. MIFA also serves teens in the community with a program that provides resources, mentoring and life skills education to help prepare teens for the college application process. in addition MIFA has a life skills institute that provedes life-changing education that guides MIFA housing opportunities clients toward self-improvment and independence.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: to provide a permanent source of supplemental funding to enhance development and growth of MIFA programs.

donations of clothing and household goods were accounted for as in-kind contributions and therefore are not included in revenues on this form 990. the in-kind donations of goods were $597,013 and in-kind expenses were $597,013 that net to $0 net income.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The initial information for the 990 is compiled by the CFO. This information is then reviewed by the CFO and executive director. upon completion of the form 990, the executive director and CFO conduct a final review. The board members are informed of the 990 filing and a copy of the form 990 is made available for any member that chooses to receive a copy.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Signed statements are completed each year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: at the time these salaries were set, mifa worked with a compensation consultant who produced comparables. since then, there have been regular raises.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All documents are available on the organization's website and upon request.
the oversight and selection process for the audit has not changed from the prior year.
